**Cf. Encyclical Letter of Pope Pius XI on Christian Marriage, St. Paul Editions (Boston, n.d.), 32:
“[H]owever much we may pity the mother whose health and even life is gravely imperiled in the
performance of the duty allotted to her by nature, nevertheless what could ever be a sufficient
reason for excusing in any way the direct murder of the innocent? This is precisely what we are
dealing with here.” Noonan (The Morality of Abortion, p. 43) reads this as fol
